programme.desc: Coverage and analysis of the 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: Second Round: Mississippi State vs. Notre Dame
programme.desc: The No. 11 Bulldogs face the No. 3 Fighting Irish in the NCAA Tournament's second round. Notre Dame topped Mississippi State in the 2018 national championship game. Mississippi State upset No. 6 Creighton in round one after winning a First Four tilt.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 2 Terrapins face the No. 7 Wildcats in the second round of the NCAA Tournament. Cate Reese stepped up with 25 points to help Arizona snap a three-game slide in the round of 64 versus No. 10 West Virginia. Maryland blasted No. 15 Holy Cross.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Angel Reese and the No. 3 Tigers play the No. 6 Wolverines in the NCAA Tournament's second round. Reese's 34 points and 15 rebounds helped LSU dispose of No. 14 Hawaii in round one. Kim Mulkey seeks a 16th trip to the Sweet 16 and first with LSU.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: Second Round: Ole Miss vs. Stanford
programme.desc: The No. 8 Rebels try to knock off the No. 1 Cardinal in the second round of the NCAA Tournament. Stanford seeks a 14th consecutive berth into the Sweet 16. The Cardinal hope to have star forward Cameron Brink who missed their opener with an illness.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In 1998, a year after the Chicago Bulls defeated Utah in the NBA Finals, their path to a sixth title only gets more challenging as it goes along, as a brutal seven-game series against the Indiana Pacers decides the Eastern Conference.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In June of 1998, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls take on the Utah Jazz in an NBA Finals rematch, looking for a sixth championship and a perfect ending for "The Last Dance."

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Host Rece Davis and analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis preview all of the day's action and discuss the biggest storylines in college basketball.

programme.title: 2023 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Steven Crowl and the No. 2 Badgers host the No. 3 Flames for an NIT second-round game. Crowl, a 7-foot junior, scored a career-high 36 points and grabbed nine rebounds in an 81-62 win over Bradley in the first round. Liberty ousted Villanova 62-57.

programme.title: 2023 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 1 Cowboys brace for Steele Venters and the Eagles in the second round of the NIT. Venters, a 6-foot-7 guard, scored 27 points in an 81-74 victory over Washington State in the first round. Oklahoma State eliminated Youngstown State 69-64.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: Each week, a half-hour episode will focus on a select team and explore previously unaired footage and sounds from game preparation, the sideline and following the final whistle.

programme.title: SEC Inside

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.sub-title: Second Round: South Dakota State vs. Virginia Tech
programme.desc: The No. 1 Hokies face the No. 9 Jackrabbits in the NCAA Tournament's second round. Myah Selland scored nine of her 29 points in overtime to lead South Dakota State past No. 8 USC in the first round, while Virginia Tech bested No. 16 Chattanooga.

programme.title: 2023 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: The No. 10 Tigers look to keep rolling against the No. 2 Utes in the NCAA Tournament's second round. Grace Stone's 3-pointer capped a 9-0 run to close out Princeton's 64-63 first-round win over No. 7 NC State, while Utah expelled No. 15 Gardner-Webb.

programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series season heats up with the RAPTOR 250 at Atlanta Motor Speedway. High school senior and 18-year-old Sammy Smith became the youngest Xfinity Series winner by claiming the United Rentals 200 at Phoenix Raceway on March 11.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron looks to stay hot as the NASCAR Cup Series visits Georgia for the Ambetter Health 400. The 25-year-old driver has won back-to-back races in March after taking the checkered flag in Phoenix last week. Byron also won this event last year.
